website_summaries.verdict: A good value price for a high-quality and durable mosquito net.
pros: Compresses well into a small, portable bundle
cons: The mesh is large enough that it doesn't keep out no-see-ums
The net as a whole is on the smaller side

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for outdoor sleeping
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVED this for his hammock. He used a tree and a nearby post to set up the perfect outdoor room. He was able to sleep in the hammock overnight with no bug bites. It was durable and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Warning
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product and there is chemical warning on the front that is not shown in the packaging photo stating the "product can expose you to chemicals including Chromium, which is known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm". I went back and looked at the listing since I definitely didn't remember seeing that in the listing and finally found it mentioned under Legal Disclaimer sandwiched between Related Video Shots and Sponsored Products Related to this Item. Needless to say I don't feel very comfortable using this for taking small children camping anymore.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Costa Rica approved :)
customer_reviews.text: it did the trick in Costa Rica in the middle of the Jungle. We were staying in a cabane with many holes everywhere and once I put it up and tuck all around the bed my wife felt safe and nothing got to us. I use it twice and we had no problems. I love that it comes with cords and hocks.
customer_reviews.author: Maxime Auger

customer_reviews.title: Used for our Hammocks
customer_reviews.text: We used ours to cover our hammocks. If you wrap string on corners or anwhere on the bottom you want you can attach a tent peg to the string to secure it to ground. We also just cut a small incision to get tge rope of the hammock in the net. We then used a string to tie off where the incision was to keep bugs out. Yep, we are geniuses. If you have a dog it can sleep under your hammock too. I love to be in the outdoors, but I hate mosquitoes so this is great. We just made it Perfect. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: TheShadyside

customer_reviews.title: Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Used it in Haiti for a month, worked GREAT! Price is right and it gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Tsakalis

customer_reviews.title: Great for hammocks!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like I'm just another hammock camper. I set it up kinda quickly and realized that I could probably use a spreader on it. It's tougher than I thought for the price. I had some cypress leaves get stuck in it and I was able to get them out without any holes. Only one mosquito the whole night. I'm going to be buying more of these now that I've tested it. Sorry it took so long to test. I'm gonna post my full setup picture to give you guys ideas. Most my gear came from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lee Cain

customer_reviews.title: Great Net
customer_reviews.text: I bought three nets (one for me, 14 yr old daughter, and a friend). We used these nets during a mission trip. Outside the net we were eaten alive. Inside the net no mosquitos. I was told by our predecessors who didn't take nets that there were no see-ums too. I was able to sleep soundly. We were the envy of those who had brought nets that secured in one spot on the top. This came with string for all four corners, even molly screws if you needed a more permanent attachment. The net held up under the use of my 14 year old who was not careful with the net.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest Couple

customer_reviews.title: Color makes such a difference
customer_reviews.text: I had this in white from another brand, and let me tell you that color makes a big difference. The white one that I had earlier was so bright white that it looked like I was walking into a hospital tent in the wilderness. The green camouflage color is so much more natural and doesn't scream for attention at the campground. Otherwise, this works fine for mosquitoes. I sprayed it with permethrin to add extra protection and repellent power.
customer_reviews.author: kmrotterdam

customer_reviews.title: Decent net, made into hammock net
customer_reviews.text: The netting is a little on the cheap side, especially since I found I can get yardage of noseeum for less money. But this net worked out for what I needed. I cut the top out, cut the net into two halves, and sewed it up into a net for my hammock. There were no nets on the market at the time of purchase that would fit over my 10 1/2 foot hammock, so I had to make one. Of course now there are nets that fit, and kits available to make your own for just a couple dollars more than this net, but again, not at the time.
customer_reviews.author: NickTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Bug Protection in the Garden
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to use in my garden. I thought if it could keep mosquitos off people maybe it could keep cabbage butterflies from laying eggs on the cabbages and collard greens growing in my garden. It's really working, the netting is held off my plants by using bamboo canes tied to the rings attached. I bought two nets. It's keeping June beetles from eating all the leaves off my rose bushes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Backstrom

customer_reviews.title: A decent net, especially for tall people
customer_reviews.text: The package says that hanging hardware is not included, but I ordered two of these and they both came with hooks, anchors, nails, and string. I've read that these box-shaped ones are better than the nets that hang from a single point in the center, especially for tall people like me because they hold the walls away from your body. The loops that are sewn into the corners for hanging seem like they will tear easily. Otherwise, this seems to be a pretty good net for traveling and camping.
customer_reviews.author: An Actual Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would look for something more tailored for kennels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom to use over some outdoor pet kennels that house cats, ones whom need special care. She runs an unofficial feral cat/disabled cat (no-kill) rescue/shelter... Anyways, I am not sure how it would do for camping but putting it over the kennels hasnt been an easy or highly effective way of keep mosquitoes out. The material does tear easily.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Gail Machnik

customer_reviews.title: These things are great. They fit really well inside the scout tents ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. They fit really well inside the scout tents at the BSA camp. I ran a few stringers across the tents to hang them from and then had to move the cots closer together, but all in all they worked really well. After setting these up, there were a lot fewer complaints from the scouts. Setting them up out in the open might pose a little bit more of a challenge. I would recommend purchasing some para-cord for suspending the net. This keeps the bugs out and you can get a better nights sleep. That is the best benefit and the whole purpose for purchasing. Enjoy your camping or out door adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Kept the bugs off
customer_reviews.text: I needed a big bet for my hammock for a last minute camping trip with my scouts. Although the shape isn't quite right, I was able to get this one delivered in two days which got my top requirement. With a few snips and clips I was able to rig it over my hammock and survived the night with no bites in a location fairly active with mosquitos. The fabric is very soft to the touch, lightweight and easy to see through. I like the rings sown along the top seams to assist with hanging it.
customer_reviews.author: RedfreakUA

customer_reviews.title: Stay bug free in bed
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for Boy Scout camp. My son and I were in army style canvas tents with tied doors no zippers. Hung the netting over our beds and were bug free all week while sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: W K S

customer_reviews.title: Coglan's Mosquito Netting
customer_reviews.text: This one has not been opened yet, but we have previously used Coghlan's Mosquito netting for beds at our cabin & they are marvellous. The little critters can buzz away, but can't get in, to eat us alive. Little awkward getting in & out, but there is no real solution for that. Small inconvenience for no bites.
customer_reviews.author: Ken D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We used this product to cover a camp cot for a week long trip and were very disappointed. The net ripped multiple times and bugs got in, making for an uncomfortable week. Also, it did not come with poles which made it difficult to set up. Will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Cartfull Dodger

customer_reviews.title: It works, but you have to be careful
customer_reviews.text: The size is very good and it fits over a twin bed well. The mesh keeps out your typical insects. The only negative is you have to be very careful setting it up. Tuck it under the mattress, bag, but leave some slop so it can shift a bit. If you make it too tight it will split and tear. I recommend it, just be careful installing.
customer_reviews.author: delump

customer_reviews.title: Used for my garden bed
customer_reviews.text: I actually used this product for my 4x4 garden box. It works great to keep out bugs. you have to be a little creative with the frame you use and staking it (andn there is a lot of extra material so you could easily use in in a 6x6 but NOT an 8x4) but I am very pleased with how I am using it. It is nice and soft too.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Rieger Thomas

customer_reviews.title: soft, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good mosquito/insect net, highly recommend. the quality is good for it's price and it's soft, doesn't scratch like the other mosquito nets we've tried.Doesn't smell bad, well made and good if you have a baby or a little kid sleeping with you. Happy with this purchase. Will purchase again if we need to. Update: My toddler accidentally pulled the corner and the ring that is attached to the net came loose. We decided to purchase again because of the good quality. We wash it always and hang dry. We put it on a small wash net to keep it in place. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: austin3:13

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for truck bed camping!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last minute before a 3 week long truck bed camping trip and I'm glad I did. Worked great draped over the open shell and just put some clips on it to secure at night. We would have gotten eaten alive without this. We packed and unpacked this many times and it got rained on and dirty but never ripped or snagged or let bugs in. Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie K

customer_reviews.title: Not just for camping - BLUEBERRIES ARE SAVED!
customer_reviews.text: We typically lose 50% of our blueberries to catbirds and robins. Tried lots of things and that black, 1" plastic mesh is awful - gets caught in the bush, you can hardly see it, basically trash at the end of the season. Commercial growers use Tobacco Netting, but it's hard to come by for some reason. Doing some Amazon research, I decided a tent netting. Arrived yesterday and works beautifully! I'll be able to gather at the base so no birds can get in. WOOT! Bushes are 4' wide and 6' tall. Fine mesh doesn't get caught in branches. Easily removed for picking.
customer_reviews.author: steve kownacki

customer_reviews.title: Great for car camping
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to put on the back of our outback when we are camping out of the car. It is nice to have the back hatch open to air out the car and to have a space where there are no bugs. We were not worried about it scratching the car because it is soft and moves easily. Its huge and useful for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Parvib

customer_reviews.title: Great for scout camp
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my scouts to take to camp with them. We used 4’ Wooden dowels with plastic water bottles on the top to hold the net up off the bed. I attached the poles to their bunk or cot with zip ties. For my daughter, I ended up using the string to suspend it from the rafters. Either way, they both stayed bug-free for the week!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good net
customer_reviews.text: Works well to keep out bugs. Setup is a little difficult with one person. I used this for a little while as a bug net with my camping hammock. I finally gave up and bought a bug net designed to work with hammocks. This net is good but wasn’t working for the application I was using it in.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awkward fit over a hammock
customer_reviews.text: It’s just okay. I tried to use it over a hammock when camping and it didn’t work out that well. I thought it was a large rectangle, but it’s really meant to be setup as a cube shaped structure. That's mostly my fault, given the picture on the package clearly shows it setup as a bug shelter. Used in that way, it may perform better. For my purpose, however, it was kind of awkward and difficult to setup. It did keep most of the bugs out, but it would require modification for use over a hammock without difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Works Great As Extra Shade for Plants
customer_reviews.text: I use these as protectors from bugs for my potato and yam tubers in their garden beds. I just draped them over four metal rods on each corner of the planter and clip them on. Sometimes, I add an extra dark sheet to the mosquito tent to give my plants more shade, since I live in Arizona. It works well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Great Mosquito for Base Camping. Fairly Durable.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these at a week-long Boy Scout camp for the last 10 years. They hold up pretty well - this is just my 2nd one so you do math. Last week at camp, I'd tuck edges of net between sleeping pad and cot. Did not have a single insect get inside my sleeping sanctum all week - plenty of the buggers on the outside though.
customer_reviews.author: College Student

customer_reviews.title: It's a very substantial product.  I'm happy as a lark with it.
customer_reviews.text: These things are really sturdy made as far as the knitting goes the attachments on them are a little cheesy the strings are a little cheesy, and the hooks are a little cheesy but those are not the main feature. The main feature has got to be that you don't want this thing ripping on you so that it's got that covered. The rest of it you can do workarounds.
customer_reviews.author: Terry  Lynn Harris

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Exactly what I was looking for to use inside my house to bond with my sugar gliders. Very fast shipping and great quality product! The double one is huge! It can go over my queen size bed! I do plan to modify it by adding PVC and sewing a bottom on with a zipper and turning the bottom into the entrance so I don't have to worry about my gliders escaping while we're playing, but I knew it didn't have a bottom when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Cary D.

customer_reviews.title: Rips easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to Peru and I was staying in a town literally in the middle of the Amazon. With the help of this and some great repellent, I didn't get bit. BUT, it's very thin and ripped the second night using it and for some strange reason it attracted flies...it was a disturbing to wake up with hanging all around.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: check your measurements
customer_reviews.text: This netting is as described, no issues at all... the seller sent it out and delivered on the specific date as promised. I thought it would be bigger which is my fault for not measuring. I have a small patio table and it has a standard outdoor umbrella in the center of it... I was able to drape this sized netting 32x78 over the umbrella.... and it fits perfectly over the umbrella and drapes to the ground. So all is not lost. We can use it outdoors while we sit at our table. I was hoping it would fit over a small canopy. No biggie. My error.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Porch Wing Netting
customer_reviews.text: Best price ever seen! We drop one over our porch swing stand and can sit out on the swing all eve without mosquitoes. Fits like it is made for it. When it is dark you can see out thru it fine and can't even tell u r under netting. Works perfectly. I have bought these for the past 6 years and they last a couple years each time.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie N.

customer_reviews.title: Used for garden
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to put over my garden to keep out squirrels and bird that were eating everything before i could pick. Literally wasn't able to enjoy one ripe item until this arrived. It was easy to place over the garden and has worked like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did the job at scout camp.
customer_reviews.text: This net was fine enough to keep all the bugs I worried about at bay. The material was strong enough to handle being used by a 7 year as well. Long enough to allow for multiple hanging methods. When used with a camp cot and mattress, it worked great to just tuck the extra length underneath he mattress.
customer_reviews.author: J Forest

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, but these work rather well for scout camp. You have to make sure they are actually covering everything and without pvc pipe frame or something similar to hold it up in the A-frame tents at camp they work well enough. It's good for the price, but they leave a bit to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: tigermother3

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bugs off!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I found and ordered this. The others I saw looked a bit cheap but was expensive. This one works perfect for my single hanging outdoor bed. I sleep now in total comfort without the nuisance of bugs crawling and flying on me!
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Curtis

customer_reviews.title: And it did a great job of protecting me from the mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how strong this netting was. And it did a great job of protecting me from the mosquitoes. This year the Zika carrying mosquitoes arrived and I found out I was strongly allergic to their saliva, causing blisters on my skin and eating away at the sub dermis and flesh. I would have been stuck inside all summer if not for this netting. And the price was reasonable, also.
customer_reviews.author: Chickie

customer_reviews.title: This one bugged me a little.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help keep the bugs away around my one-person tent, when I'm pocking out through the top of the tent to get dressed or whatever. I used the smaller tent to travel lighter, but this net doesn't pack too compactly and setting it up took more effort than it was worth for me to bother on my first trip out with it, when it mostly rained a lot. It may prove more useful on a subsequent, buggier trip. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoBoy

customer_reviews.title: What defines multicolored
customer_reviews.text: likes: arrived on time Dislikes: what defines multicolored? Recieved omnicolored White. Not sure who's at fault..picking or packaging. What i am sure of is: stealth camping with a White bugnet is definitely Not Stealthy.
customer_reviews.author: Zman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for summer camp
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed for cub scout camp. We were able to hang this up using bamboo stakes for the 4 corners of the cot and duck tape the stakes in place. Loved that they came with a bag to store and will definitely be able to use them again for camp next year
customer_reviews.author: bekaj13

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to help protect pet hutches
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge rabbit hutch for my pet rabbit and needed something to help keep away annoying mosquitoes and flies. Before I had used mesh wiring to attach on the outside cage of the hutch which was annoying to do. But with a brand new hutch, it was easier to get a mesh net to fit over the entire hutch. And i love that it is very elastic that it could stretch beyond the given dimensions that are on the bag. Overall i feel this was the best purchase to help protect my rabbit against annoying insects.
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: Size is different
customer_reviews.text: Package size info is wrong. It's actually 74 inches long by 31 inches wide by 58 inches high. I measured it to fit before I made a frame from PVC to put inside the net to keep bugs and birds away from tomato plants. Keep in mind this height measurement doesn't allow any extra to drape around the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Old GAME

customer_reviews.title: It's fine, rips easily
customer_reviews.text: This did the job. It was fine. My daughter used this at sleep-away camp and it was ripped by the end, but I am sure it was at least partially her part because it was a tight fit over rough poles. Just keep that in mind -- be careful when securing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Shops Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great for a baby camper
customer_reviews.text: I used it under our 10x10 canopy to keep the bees and masquitos away from baby while he played in his play pen. It was a way cheaper option than getting a pop up net. It is also easy to get to the baby quickly without letting in the bugs. There was enough room for his high chair and a chair for me to sit down and feed him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job; irregular dimensions
customer_reviews.text: This does the job it was intended for: to offer light duty protection against mosquitos indoors. It works for that. My only complaint is the dimensions are not even. I know this because we attached hooks to the wall to support the corners and the hooks on one end had to be placed a few inches further apart than the other. This does not affect its performance, as it still fits nicely over a double bed -- there is a bit of extra room in its width. Just be sure to measure both sides separately if you're installing this permanently.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great bug netting for tomatoes
customer_reviews.text: I use this as insect deterrent for my tomato plants. It drapes much better and is taller than just a sheet of butterfly netting which I have to wrap and wrap. I will probably buy another one for other plants.
customer_reviews.author: Jrob24

customer_reviews.title: Great for hammocks
customer_reviews.text: This net came in handy for our hammock in the back yard. Since there is a creek not too far from our yard, the mosquito problem is obvious. With the net hanging over the individual in the hammock, that person is safe. However, it is only large enough for a single person, so if it id a wide hammock, like ours is, one of the individuals will not be fully covered because it is a little short. Otherwise, it is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mel & Freddi

customer_reviews.title: Works great and holds up well.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this brand and size before. It worked great, in use daily throughout the summer for well over ten years. Just purchased two more. They look even better than the first one.
customer_reviews.author: hmschoolmom

customer_reviews.title: No More CREEPY CRAWLIES or Buzzing Mosquitos = Peaceful Sleep at Camp!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Girl Scout Camp and it was the perfect size! It's as though it was meant for the rectangular twin size beds that had metal arched frames at the head and foot of the bed. Was a life saver...kept the mosquito's and spiders out. A real life saver for overnight camp in open air tents! It was plenty long, going to the floor with a snug enough fit that there were no loose ends = no creepy crawlies in the middle of the night! I recently ordered a 2nd one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: capecodsplash

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: This net was listed as extra large but is actually very small, it might cover a chair and that's it. I do not recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from a Mission Trip to Haiti. These trips at always the toughest for me. We sleep in bunk beds and the mosquitos and other things that bite like our NJ blood. This net was the greatest. It covered a tall, two level metal framed bunk which gave me a lot of protection and allowed me to get "in" , under cover and keep "all" boarders out. It was large enough that I could use my CPAP machine on the top level , "under cover" (or netting") and I could move around without getting bit! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: John Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: Simple But Effective
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. I had no bug bites sleeping with this in the deep woods for a week with this over my cot. I attached four -48" - 5/8" dowels to the legs of the cot with zip ties and put tennis balls over the end of each dowel and draped the net over the cot. Simple, but quite effective.
customer_reviews.author: Ken C

customer_reviews.title: Good and large
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Larger than expected. It's a little too heavy to take along on backpacking trip so I don't know if I'll ever actually use it but it's only heavy because it's so big. It's overkill for just one person. Might be smart to take along for two or three people.
customer_reviews.author: Patience Carter

customer_reviews.title: Alternate use than for mosquitos...
customer_reviews.text: We used the mosquito netting to keep cats out of our garden. We put up a pvc frame and it has worked great. Now that the plants are older we'll need to either make holes in the netting so bees can get in or adjust it around the frame differently. It is very effective to keep bugs and neighborhood cats out, should you so desire.
customer_reviews.author: TCooper

customer_reviews.title: Massive Net and very well made.  High quality
customer_reviews.text: Great mosquito net. But I am not using it for its intended purchase, I'll be cutting it up to use to make scarves for the holidays. I needed a good netting and this is amazing. It is HUGE, the dimensions are massive and it was packed in a nice tight package (which it will never be able to go back into.. I think it was packed by magical elves.) Although the amount of bites I got last night from mowing I wonder if there is a way to surround myself as I mow my yard. I got this at a discount for an honest review.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Bre

customer_reviews.title: Something everyone should have
customer_reviews.text: It keeps almost every size of bug out. Some baby gnats might sneak in, but they arent much more than a bit annoying. It comes with little hooks that you can srew into a tree or the ground. The net a can also be nailed or taped down on a window still if you are missing a screen! 10 out of 10. Its not the highest quality, it rips easily, but the price is absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Layne McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Prevention from donating blood
customer_reviews.text: I'm looking at rigging this up inside my tent for double protection. The mosquitos here in Minnesota are so big they have wood-ticks hanging on them.
customer_reviews.author: Yaya

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and good price too
customer_reviews.text: I always buy this mosquito nets to take to Cuba they work just fine mi mother love them it is a lot mosquito over there they last to good fabric
customer_reviews.author: rolando escobar

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mosquito net for camping. Just make sure you have a way to hang it. My son took it to Boy Scout Camp for the week, and it worked well. Price on Amazon can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: LAS

customer_reviews.title: sleep soundly with a mosquito net
customer_reviews.text: Coghlans makes some practical and common camping products. The mosquito net is a good product. While sleeping in an open tent on a platform at a Boy Scout merit badge week I attached my mosquito net over my cot that was provided. It's a common Boy Scout practice to use 4 pre sized dowels (duct taped to the cot frame) and 4 tennis balls on top of the dowels to drape your mosquito netting over your cot. The Coglan' mosquito is well made to do this as well as have rings on it to secure it further.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for protection against those pesky summer insects
customer_reviews.text: The size and shape can be used as a screen for a covered porch or over your hammock or even over a picnic table. I've tried it out on all three and am really happy with the size and versatility
customer_reviews.author: Melek

customer_reviews.title: No Chikungunya for me!
customer_reviews.text: Bought and used this net for some time spent in Haiti due to a Chikungunya outbreak. It was easy to hang using the supplied string and some gorilla tape. The mesh is fine enough to keep out Mosquitos and other smaller insects. There is no zipper, which was not a problem for me, I simply lifted the edge and slipped into bed. Construction quality was fine, it hasn't ripped or snagged at all. Over all, worth every penny I spent and better then some of the more expensive "designer" nets some of our team had.
customer_reviews.author: L. Clair

customer_reviews.title: Wont buy again not very big
customer_reviews.text: It does not fit over my hammock like I thought it would so I dont use it
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Piece of mind and great hardware
customer_reviews.text: Attachments really helped ensure optimal hanging. Used this in Southeast Asia and in mosquito infested areas. Gave me piece of mind while sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S.

customer_reviews.title: Better for people than pets
customer_reviews.text: Could not use it for what I needed. Probably a good mosquito net, too thin for my dogs crate, they can tear through it.
customer_reviews.author: debyan

customer_reviews.title: Just fine
customer_reviews.text: Worked just fine for my son at Boy Scout camp. It was nice that it came with the ropes to hang it. One of the rings did come off as we were putting it up the first time, but we were able to get it back on. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kao M Moua

customer_reviews.title: I'm using for projector material
customer_reviews.text: I'm not actually using this for it's mosquito protective properties, so I can't comment on that. I'm using it a an outdoor, rear projection screen for some AtmosFear FX. I wanted an inexpensive screen that would be difficult to see in the dark but was thick enough to display an image. They sell special screens for this purpose that are 3-4 times more expensive. It does the job well and I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Chambers

customer_reviews.title: worked well for a hammock!
customer_reviews.text: I hate bugs around our hammock, so I love this for keeping the bugs away from our hammock! It's a little odd to set up hanging from trees around it, but it works great when just right because it touches the edge of the hammock and sort of goes underneath to create a little bubble of bug protection. I would definitely recommend this for outdoor use. It's also fairly easy to set up normally.
customer_reviews.author: L.B.

customer_reviews.title: B+
customer_reviews.text: Used this in the field on my most recent backpacking trip. Worked well kept the bugs out. Just the bug net weighs 8 ounces. I will keep this set up for a while
customer_reviews.author: Adam Henning

customer_reviews.title: Relatively good size and durable
customer_reviews.text: The size is listed. It's for camping more than home or vacation home use. It's more than enough for the length of a single/twin mattress but not as wide. You can easily walk in it a bit at 5' high. The mesh is fine that looked delicate. When I put it over a raw wooden pet house, it got trapped by the wood grain many times. I have to pull carefully to finish the job. But the net wasn't broken yet. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Piraha Mura

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bugs out!
customer_reviews.text: It packs easily, it comes with all the things you would need to hang it up while camping! Worked great at camp. My son and I both used one all week at camp and we usually get eaten alive, this net does its job
customer_reviews.author: crystal conroy

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping when you really want to be completely outdoors! Nice to be able to see the moon and the stars, which is often not possible in a tent. Kept the bugs out! Happy camper ...
customer_reviews.author: CEG

customer_reviews.title: great to have
customer_reviews.text: We were having a mosquitoes problem in the house so we had to use this temporarily. They are also great when camping
customer_reviews.author: MERivers

customer_reviews.title: Very nice netting
customer_reviews.text: Double-wide model is more than big enough. Well-seamed with split rings for putting it up. 240-size seems to be plenty small enough to keep everybody out (definitely not noseeums and possibly determined smaller gnats, which this isn't advertised for). The included hardware looks to be a touch flimsy, but fine for a beginner or somebody in a cabin, etc. Definitely happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Llama3534

customer_reviews.title: Great for Big Mosquitos.
customer_reviews.text: Last year we had huge mosquitos and I was happy with this net. This year we have smaller mosquitos that just buzz right through the netting. The craftsmanship is great, but the design might need to be tweaked a little.
customer_reviews.author: Okiebert

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, would buy again if needed. Used to cover tomato plants to prevent birds from eating.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: I used this to make fly-proof covers for containers and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this net so I could cut it up in smaller pieces and it works fine for that. I needed smaller pieces to use as the covers for containers. The mesh is okay for keeping out mosquitoes and fruit flies, but it's not the smallest mesh I've ever seen. It was good for the price. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Clothes Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a mission trip to Haiti and it was great, well worth the price. It kept the mosquitos off me while I slept and the only bites I had were on my hands that were at at the edge of the net. It's a good sized net that covered the full-sized bed and has enough length to sit up in. The included string would've been good to hang the net off a bunk bed or something, but I ended up using duck tape and paracord to hang the net off the ceiling and walls. I left the net for the next group going to Haiti.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Used on a mission trip. We fit it over a frame we made of thin PVC pipe that was zip-ties to the top of a bunk bed. Net was made of quality material and kept the bugs out.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: The ease to use and can get some relaxation not letting the mosquito  bite
customer_reviews.text: High quality material and keep this darn mosquitoes away so I can get some sleep while camping out nice mosquito net
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: TMR - KEOWA CAMP - Summer 2015
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this net for KEOWA Scout Camp @ TMR, GNYC Summer 2015. . The netting is larger and longer than standard netting and easily fit over a 6 foot cot and covered my son without a single insect/bug getting in!! It provided plenty of room for sleeping. Only suggestion to the manufacturer is to make the connection of the net to the six metal rings (for connecting the netting to the tent frame) a bit more sturdy -- maybe use a thin line of paracord that will work much better.... Over all very satisfied with purchase. AB
customer_reviews.author: Fabio66 FH

customer_reviews.title: The net does not fully enclose!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this net for my daughter to avoid getting bit up, by the mosquitoes. I received it and unfortunately it does not fully enclose. The mosquitoes can just fly underneath the net. It is very thin and flimsy. The ties it comes with are no more then thick pieces of thread/string. It is not a very well made product in my opinion. I am returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with instructions
customer_reviews.text: The product did not come with instructions and so I had a difficult time setting it up. I ended up ghetto rigging it with tape. In the end, the area I was trying to cover was too big, so that was my fault for not ordering a larger size (if there even was an even larger one, I don't recall). I've since thrown the net to the side and have not used it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny F.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this net hoping to string it up over my camping hammock. The picture on the packaging is slightly misleading, because the top part of the netting is more of a square shape as opposed to a rectangle. That made it difficult to hang up over a hammock, and I ended up attaching the net to one end and tucking the other end under my feet. Now granted, this isn't advertised as hammock bug net, so I can't give it a completely horrible review. It kept the bugs off, but I'll probably just save this for other uses, rather than a camping trip again.
customer_reviews.author: iGlow

customer_reviews.title: Really big!
customer_reviews.text: This is like a tent, we are using it like a screen on the back of our boat at night. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very place specific product
customer_reviews.text: It is a box. A very narrow box. Make sure you have tall trees to tie it to else it will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on a recent camping trip. Used two of these around my cot and my son's in a heavy mosquito area. Kept the bugs out while we slept. Very thin, but surprisingly durable. I thought they may have ripped a few times when drug over corners of the cots, but held together. Multiple rings to tie the net and plenty of length/width. Packed them up and will use again!
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping mosquitoes and cockroaches (
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping mosquitoes and cockroaches (!!) away during the night. I was staying in a cockroach infested room for 2 months while abroad - in order to get a good night's rest I set up the net and tucked it under my bedding. I know it wasn't totally roach-proof, but I slept much better knowing they would have to work hard to get through the netting and crawl over me in my sleep. Overall the net is easy to set up and quite strong. I plan to use it again!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Fulfilled the Need Despite the Holes
customer_reviews.text: Which it worked for our general needs, arrived quickly and was of a substantial size, we noticed that is got runs and holes quickly and easily. You only needed to run it along the tiniest of burs from the PVC poles we created and there was a hole. This may be a case of getting what we paid for, however it still fulfilled the need.
customer_reviews.author: Tammayrend

customer_reviews.title: Get a floor-saver without fail.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice screen tent, zippers are good quality and construction of the tent is durable. A floor-saver is a must, the floor is thin, very thin, and it seems like punctures could easily happen, but can reasonably be avoided by a floor-saver and clearing debris- kind of a pricey tent but the tent is a great value so with proper consideration the tent should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Hull

customer_reviews.title: Using for the garden
customer_reviews.text: Using this as a bug net for my garden. It did its job keeping the moths out as there was absolutely no caterpillars this season.
customer_reviews.author: Dude Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Uganda orphanage
customer_reviews.text: I sent this to my friends Orphanage in Uganda and they loved these mosquito nets
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for my bunny hutch
customer_reviews.text: I got this net for my rabbit hutch to protect my bunny from mosquitos and other insects. I got the 32x78 and found it to be bigger than expected but it’s perfect for the hutch.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Abapo

customer_reviews.title: Giving a bad review
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these, one came with a mesh stuff sack the other didnt.. BAD REVIEW FOR YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Famous Artist Music

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for putting over cot at scout camp!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Great buy-affordable and just the size we needed. My son used this over his cot during his week at Boy Scout camp since there are no zippers on the tents they use there. They attached PVC pipe to the 4 corners of the cot with zip ties, put caps or tennis balls on the tops of the PVC to keep it from ripping the net, and then draped the net over the top. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't help mosquitos problem in Texas!
customer_reviews.text: Not great. The mosquitos still fly in underneath and then you are really stuck as you are locked in with a mosquito eating you up. It needs weights at the bottom and much better support BUT for the price what did I expect. At least they are trying.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go over a Grand Trunk camping hammock. I used cords through the metal loops on the top of the net and a couple of clothes pins to clamp the netting around the ends of the hammock. I also used a clothespin to hold the edges of the netting together under the hammock. Completely bug proof. Tip: I used a stick to hold the loops apart over my head to give me more headroom. You might not need this depending on the diameter of your trees. Also very light to carry in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for boy scout camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my son's boy scouting camping trip in the heat of summer. It's very light and just the right size over a small bed in the cabin. Very good value!
customer_reviews.author: Blizzard

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son’s week long camping trip. He said it was easy to put up and kept the bugs out while he slept.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2thePookiesx3

product_meta.title: COGHLANS 9640 32x78 Mosquito Bed Net
product_meta.description: Those bugs may be flying all around you, but they surely won't be bothering you while you're catching some Zs with the Mosquito Net from Coghlan's. PRODUCT FEATURES:
feature_bullets: Rectangular single-wide mosquito net provides fully enclosed protection against biting insects and mosquitoes when sleeping outdoors or indoors
Fine white 180 mesh polyester netting with floor base completely covers a single wide sleeping bag or cot
Six reinforced metal tie tabs at corners and sides; anchor four corners into ground, hang top two corners from tree or posts
Durable mildew resistant polyester netting packs in easy enclosing carrying bag

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
